title: fix(tests): Ticket Rules Futures
body:
My current theory is that we're seeing flakey tests because of the inconsistent way we're using generators in python. This PR removes the need to override the parent `after()` definition.

Also I noticed a weird thing where we accidentally put the Jira Ticket Rules validator in the wrong class so I fixed that.

title: ref(ui): issue details layout
body:
The issue details page is overwhelming and cramped today. Also, we’ve consistently heard feedback from new customers that they don’t know what the Issue ID is. So this PR does the following:

- adds breadcrumbs to the issue details page which makes it much more obvious what the ID is
- removes a ton of bananas css and old bootstrap stuff
- fixes layout of the header at smaller sizes
- makes things more consistent by using our Layout component

title: fix(slack): `AlertRuleTriggerActionSerializer` weirdness
body:
Ok this is a weird problem. It looks like when we're asynchronously updating the `input_channel_id` for a _Slack_ `AlertRuleTriggerAction`, we're seeing serialization errors in other parts of the AlertRule.

This PR will fix the problem in this case by always removing the `sentry_app_installation_uuid` field during validation, but a longer term fix would be to prevent a `AlertRuleTriggerAction` of type `SentryApp` from being incorrectly saved without `sentry_app_config`.

Fixes [SENTRY-TMD](https://sentry.io/organizations/sentry/issues/3144468587).

title: fix(new-widget-builder-experience): Show builder when editing
body:
The builder should be accessible through the edit state's Edit Widget
button even when the modal flag is on.

If it isn't accessible, then we don't have a way to edit using the builder if the modal is turned on.

I removed the `isEditing` by accident when switching the leftover modal pathways to opening the builder. See: https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/pull/33012/files#diff-f31a7455ebe4fc5038b163d509258d674d6804163c903317f953921c2c60ec44L358

title: fix(reprocessing): Apply fresh grouping config [ISSUE-1415]
body:
Reprocessing is a feature for native platforms intended to re-apply debug files, as stated in our [docs](https://docs.sentry.io/product/issues/reprocessing/):

> Reprocessing allows you to apply debug information files to error events that have already occurred.

The behavior of reprocessing with regards to grouping configuration has been inconsistent: While fingerprinting rules were always taken fresh from the project, stack trace rules and the grouping strategy were taken from the event:

https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/blob/c69ac2e5d8962499659c3b22608911927782d366/src/sentry/event_manager.py#L1716

https://github.com/getsentry/sentry/blob/c69ac2e5d8962499659c3b22608911927782d366/src/sentry/event_manager.py#L392-L394

This PR aligns this behavior by always loading the grouping config from the project when handling a reprocessed event.

title: fix(workflow): Handle remove from issue list when Auto Resolve is enabled
body:
Previously, there was a bug when you went to the saved/custom search tab that included issues that were Auto Resolved where the page would continuously refresh causing several search queries to fire. This is also a fix related to [INC-108](https://getsentry.atlassian.net/browse/INC-108).

Reproducible Steps:
- have Auto Resolve enabled in project settings
- make a search query that includes any issue that has been auto resolved
- notice the Network tab in the dev console making several requests 

[FIXES WOR-1642](https://getsentry.atlassian.net/browse/WOR-1642) - reproducible video in jira ticket

title: feat(perf): Strip away aggregate filters in span details search
body: This PR removed aggregate filters from the span view. Aggregate filters in the search bar are applied to transactions, so users moving to the span view might face unexpected behavior when the same aggregate filters are applied to spans. This behavior is consistent with how we show transaction summary.

title: feat(replay): Load all events with a given replayId on the details page
body: Pass in a `replayId` url param instead of an `eventId` so that we can fetch all events associated with that replay, and then dump N replay-viewers on the screen. I put one instance of the `` because the tags for every set of `sentry-replay` events should be the same... as the data model evolves that will be a guarantee. This version of the page will show... in the main section: - A list of `eventIds` that share the same `replayId` - For each `eventId` one rrweb player The colored boxes in the screen shot below illustrate the connections from eventId to rrweb player: Fixes #33060

title: build(deps-dev): bump size-limit from 5.0.5 to 7.0.8
body:
Bumps [size-limit](https://github.com/ai/size-limit) from 5.0.5 to 7.0.8.
Changelog

Sourced from size-limit's changelog.

7.0.8

  • Fixed peer dependencies.

7.0.7

  • Fixed plugin versions in presets.

7.0.6

  • Added brotlied note to CLI output (by @​azat-io).
  • Updated nanospinner.

7.0.5

  • Added pnpm examples to migration guide.
  • Fixed docs (by @​azat-io).

7.0.4

  • Updated esbuild.
  • Updated nanospinner.

7.0.3

  • Fixed package size.

7.0.2

  • Fixed peer dependency ignore in @size-limit/esbuild.

7.0.1

  • Fixed --save-bundle arguments with @size-limit/esbuild.
  • Fixed ignore option with @size-limit/esbuild.
  • Fixed brotli option without webpack.
  • Fixed error messages.

7.0

  • Added @size-limit/esbuild plugin for better performance (by Artem Tumin).
  • Moved @size-limit/preset-small-lib to @size-limit/esbuild.
  • Moved CSS from webpack plugin to @size-limit/webpack-css (by Egor Ogarkov).
  • Moved --why to @size-limit/webpack-why (by Egor Ogarkov).

6.0.4

  • Updated dependencies.

6.0.3

  • Updated nanospinner.

6.0.2

  • Fixed Statoscope report location (by Sergey Melyukov).

6.0.1

  • Replaced mico-spinner to nanospinner.

6.0

  • Moved to webpack 5 (by Ludovico Fischer).

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

title: fix(endpoints): Integration Directory
body:
I have a theory that bad query parameter parsing is causing us to accidentally fetch third-party configurations for every integration on the Integrations Directory. I can see what parameters are sent to the backend but I don't really have a great way to test how they're being interpreted. 

This PR creates a generic parser for query params and hopefully when this is merged page load times will go down.

title: Client State endpoint
body:
This PR creates a new endpoint for storing arbitrary client state with a TTL.
Our use case for this is that we would like to save onboarding state for a fixed period of time so that when the user comes back to the onboarding page, the selected projects & integrations would still be there.

The config for the redis cluster was added here:
https://github.com/getsentry/getsentry/pull/7266

The payload size is limited by a parameter set in each category. For the case of onboarding state, that's 1024 characters for each organization member.

title: fix(modals): Fix Modal escape handler not closing the modal in some scenarios
body:
~State update causes the browser to lose focus of the modal which makes the escape button no longer close the modal. This forces the browser to focus back on the modal so that pressing escape will work.~

Updates the `handleEscapeClose` event listener to apply to the entire `document` instead of just the modal portal. This fixes scenarios where the browser focus may not be in the modal portal and pressing escape doesn't properly close the modal.

title: feat(alerts): Alert Wizard V3 template selector
body:
This adds a dropdown in the metric selector in the alert wizard that can change the aggregate function, same way you would select an aggregate in the radio button selection step before the alert form step. Aggregate is changed in the url and the dropdown field follows the value from the url.
